intro: Acinodendron octoscenidium, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its rapid growth and invasive potential, it is considered a weed in some areas.
